Principal Strategic Planner

Company Name City of Casey Company Location Narre Warren

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 29 views

Job description

  • 1 x Limited Tenure Full Time position until 30 September 2019

\xa0Summary


The City of Casey is one of the fastest growing municipalities in Australia and already has a population of over 320,000 people.\xa0\xa0 Council has an exciting vision for the municipality to be Australia’s most liveable city.\xa0\xa0 Council has an exciting opportunity to join the City Planning Department.


You will be working on exciting and innovative City-building projects and working at the award winning Bunjil Place which offers staff a modern, flexible and collaborative working environment.


The role


This role sits within the City Strategy Team where you will lead the preparation and delivery of activity centre structure plans, in-fill housing development plans and township strategies.


You will also be responsible to demonstrate leadership in the development and implementation of\xa0Council adopted Strategic polices and plans whilst also mentoring other team members.


About You


To be successful in this role you will have excellent communication, project management and stakeholder management skills. A passion and enthusiasm for working with stakeholders to achieve quality strategic planning outcomes is critical in this role.\xa0


Salary begins at $95,575 per annum plus super


\xa0


We encourage people with a disability, lived experience of disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait islanders and people from culturally diverse backgrounds to apply for this position.


The City of Casey has zero tolerance for child abuse and is committed to creating and maintaining a child safe organisation where protecting children and preventing and responding to child abuse is embedded in the everyday thinking and practice of all Councillors, employees, contractors and volunteers.


The City of Casey reserves the right not to make any appointments for this position.

Program Coordinator / Manager

Company Name Marshall McAdam Company Location Fawkner, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 75 views

Be an early applicant

Job description



    • Fantastic opportunity for a jrn project manager / program coordinator
    • 6 months + contract role
    • Based in North West Suburbs of Melbourne


    Program Coordinator / Manager


    The role of program coordinator/manager is to support, facilitate and report on a Program of Work to deliver the client's Customer First & Digital Transformation strategy and the ICT Uplift program.


    The responsibilities will include (but not be limited to):

    • Develop and deliver services and support for the ICT project and program management capability across the organisation to reduce project related risk;
    • Establish the Program governance model (governance, establishment of success metrics, business engagement approach, resourcing, planning, scheduling, sourcing, financial management and communications) in conjunction with the Program Director;
    • Review and maintain the standard set of practices, processes and templates for managing projects consistently and efficiently to reduce project related risk and costs;
    • Consolidate and validate both Transformation program and ICT Uplift program streams planning including scoping, detailed sourcing, resource and cost planning; and
    • Manage regular review forums, standups and team meetings.


    The success criteria will be:

    • Program governance implemented and enacted (cost, scope, value, risk)
    • Program resourcing balanced to meet agreed deliverable outcomes (initiatives)
    • Program delivers nominated benefits (validated via tracking methodologies)


    To be successful in this role your background and cv will demonstrate:

    • Solid planning and solution compilation experience - ability to take the components of solution and factor into planning to support key deliverable outputs.
    • Experience / exposure to DevOps model for delivery of change and new digital experiences.
    • Very strong Program Management and Project Office skills
    • Experience with Agile delivery practices and processes
    • Knowledge and experience of Microsoft packages, including Project, PowerPoint, Word and Excel


    This role is a fantastic opportunity to stretch yourself into a project manager role. You will be working within a collaborative team with an insightful and experienced Programme Director. The role is based on site at the client which is in the North West suburbs of Melbourne. There is a train station on-site and parking also available.


    If this role sounds of interest, please apply by clicking on the link below.

815909904:
[

HR Advisor, Australian Programs

Company Name Save the Children Australia Company Location Carlton, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 253 views

Job description


There is an HR Advisor, and then there is an HR Advisor at Save the Children Australia. With us, you will be the first point of contact for a diverse and ambitious client group: Australian Programs. Working in over 200 sites, across most States and Territories, with over 600 staff, this team is at the core of what we deliver as an organisation; sustainable programs to support the most vulnerable children. Your contribution to that is essential.


Save the Children is no ordinary not-for-profit.
We're ambitious, creative and outspoken. We stand up for children's rights. We want all children to be educated, healthy and live a life free from violence. We run programs in Australia and overseas and, if there's a disaster - like an earthquake, drought or conflict - we are there on the ground.


Where you come in:
In this full-time position, based in Carlton, you will see real-time value of your HR coaching and support. You will support the management of the employee lifecycle across all sites by working effectively with all levels of management and contribute to a broad range of people initiatives. This may involve travelling to state offices and in some circumstances, you may have unique opportunities to visit regional and remote communities across Australia. You will be part of our People & Culture team and report to our HR Manager, Australian Programs.


You will make an impact by:

  • Coaching, advising and supporting the second line management team of Australian Programs by acting as their first point of contact for generalist related queries
  • Providing IR / ER support and advice, including end-to-end case management at all levels of the Australian Programs team
  • Being a trusted advisor by supporting and assisting managers to undertake and implement HR processes in their teams
  • Analysing people data to determine trends and develop appropriate interventions and / or training
  • Supporting and managing key strategic HR projects for Australian Programs
  • Developing and maintaining strong and effective relationships that model organisational behaviours and values




If we could compose the perfect you…
…You are an ambitious HR Generalist who is looking to step into a role that stretches you by exposing you to elements outside the 'norm'. Known for your service delivery you are accountable, trusted and able to adjust your approach that enables stakeholders to feel heard and supported. You enjoy partnering and collaborating with your clients to understand their pain points and work towards a suitable solution. You enjoy working in a supportive, fast-paced and dynamic environment. One where you can be truly innovative and bring your passion to work.


This role requires:

  • Solid experience in a broad generalist role
  • Demonstrated experience in managing performance issues, grievances and other ER issues incl. case management
  • Working knowledge of relevant legislation incl. policy and award interpretation
  • Stakeholder engagement skills with a strong coaching element
  • Strong service delivery experience with a customer centric focus




Working at Save the Children is more than just a job.
It's the feeling of knowing that your work is contributing to making the world a better place for children and working with others who feel the same. In addition to a connection to social causes, you will have access to:

  • Opportunity to work on additional projects alongside business as usual
  • Individual learning plans to assist in your career development
  • Internal employment and development opportunities
  • Friendly and flexible work environment incl. working from home
  • Tuesday and Friday 'bring a pet to work' days
  • Competitive salary + super + full salary sacrificing benefits




Sound interesting?
We'd love to hear from you. Submit your cover letter and resume by clicking on one of the buttons in the 'Apply' section below.

Applications close 5.00pm Wednesday 5 September 2018. For enquiries contact Craig Wood, Recruitment & Sourcing Specialist, on 03 7002 1763.

Position Description - HR Advisor, Australian Programs

At Save the Children, we seek a workforce that is as diverse as our society - in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexuality, cultures and beliefs - and reflects the communities we work in. We believe diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our culture and core values and we demonstrate this commitment through all our employment practices. Our inclusive workplace culture contributes to making Save the Children a great place to work.
Save the Children Australia is a child-safe organisation. All employees are required to undergo a National Police Check, a Working with Children Check where necessary, and sign our Child Protection Policy and Code of Conduct.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Civic & Social Organization
  • Human Resources
  • Staffing and Recruiting

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Customer Service
  • Human Resources

[

Senior Specialist, Buying (eCommerce)

Company Name adidas Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 350 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Please note applicants must have legal rights to work in Australia. No Relocation or Visa support is offered for this role.

_______________________________________________________________________

Purpose & Overall Relevance For The Organisation

The Senior Specialist, Buying will be responsible for managing and developing the merchandising plans for all categories present in the eCommerce / online business. The primary goal of this person is to create merchandising plans to achieve the overall financial objectives of while in alignment with the overall business goals and CTC priorities. This role incorporates Pacific eCom In season Merchandising Planning, Assortment and Roll Out Strategies that deliver enhanced consumers’ online shopping experience

Key Responsibilities
  • Supporting and consult category and channel assortment planners with range architecture and selection of ‘what product the consumer sees’ for the responsible category.
  • Deliver financial and range efficiency targets i.e. OTB, Sell-thru, category shares, Stock-turn and Net margin targets for responsible category
    • Responsible and accountable for Net sales, Sell-through, Std. margin an the respective forecasting process
    • Own & lead the overall range management
    • Range selections for programs and projects as per agreed OTB & range size targets
    • Actual range selection during Trade meetings every season
    • Drive Range and buy sign-offs
    • On-time handover of sizing & FC for procurement teams.
  • Internal alignment & coordination with key stakeholders to efficiently launch products, manage sell-thru and promotions within the season.
  • Support process and deliverables with FINANCE/BU/MOPS/SCM teams to deliver
    • Category targets and respective monthly forecasting by business segment
    • OTB, Inventory planning, sell-through & stock turn
    • Handover range and forecasts at agreed timelines to ensure timely POs ( Pre-Season)
  • Management of phasing & giving timely signals to Demand planning to pursue replenishment/re-order of fast-moving articles ( In-Season)


Key Relationships
  • CTC
  • Finance
  • eCommerce Marketing Activation
  • eCommerce Operations
  • eCommerce Site optimization& UX
  • MOPS
  • SCM & Purchasing


Knowledge, Skills And Abilities
  • Detailed knowledge of Merchandising, Merchandise planning, ranging & forecasting
  • Good knowledge of all eCommerce channels/online marketing
  • Very strong excel skills
  • Strong analytical skills and fact-based orientation in decision making
  • Strong communication skills


Qualifications (Minimum Required Education And Experience)
  • Minimum 5+ years’ experience in product marketing, range management & merchandising preferably with a background in sporting goods.
  • A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in business, marketing, communications or related field.
  • Experienced in working with internal stakeholders and external agencies to establish efficient and scalable processes
  • Experienced in working cross-functional within the international organization
  • Fluent Business English

What’s on offer?

A competitive base salary, bonus scheme and adidas employee benefits are also on offer to the successful candidate.

How do I apply?
  • Press the "Apply" button and follow the instructions
  • You will be required to fill out the online applications forms, and attach a copy of your resume and cover letter which addresses all above candidate requirements
  • Applications which do not attach a cover letter which addresses the job requirements specific to adidas will not be considered.
  • Applications will only be accepted through the steps above
  • Please note that due to the high volume of applications adidas receives, we will be unable to respond to all individual inquiries.

817314232:
[

Senior Strategic Planner

Company Name City of Melbourne Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 240 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


$106,988 + 9.5% Superannuation

Temporary to 31 December 2019

City of Melbourne is committed to supporting diversity, inclusion and flexibility. Applicants seeking flexible and part-time arrangements are encouraged to apply.

For more information on what it is like working with us at City of Melbourne please go to working with us at City of Melbourne

City of Melbourne recognises the value of the diversity and strength of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultures to the heritage of all Australians and encourages Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply. You will be supported in your application via our Aboriginal Employment Team.

Our Urban Strategy branch is seeking to engage a Senior Strategic Planner to join their team.



How this position will Make the Difference to City of Melbourne…

Reporting to the Team Leader, Planning Policy, the Senior Strategic Planner provides strategic, creative urban planning thinking and expertise to areas of significant change in the city, contributing to strategies, structure plans, planning policy and projects that shape the city. The Senior Strategic Planner will translate visions, strategies and plans into formal planning policy, engaging proactively and expertly with established planning processes under the Melbourne Planning Scheme to ensure Council is in a strong position to leverage high quality place and development outcomes. The Senior Strategic Planner will also support city shaping strategic projects such as land use and infrastructure planning.

As a senior member of the team and branch, you will take a lead role in ensuring the work of the branch delivers high quality places and outcomes for people, adopts inventive, best practice and multi-disciplinary approaches to city change and is an advocate for the work of the branch and its role. You will manage end to end complex, multi-disciplinary cross-organisational projects and will lead project teams, along with managing an element of infrastructure planning. You will collaborate across the organisation to propose evidence-based planning policy to enable the delivery of a world class city, precincts, neighbourhoods and places into the future.

This role will work in collaboration with a range of internal and external stakeholders, therefore strong and effective communication skills are required as well as the ability to build influence, problem solve, negotiate and resolve. Planning expertise, project management and relationship and stakeholder management are core capabilities of this role.


You can bring… (Selection criteria)

  • Ability to demonstrate and display City of Melbourne Values – accountability, integrity, courage, respect for self and others, and striving for excellence
  • Relevant tertiary qualification and experience in the area of strategic urban planning or a closely related field such as urban design
  • Demonstrated experience and ability in the development of planning schemes with preference for the Victorian system
  • Demonstrated ability to lead cross-corporate and multi-organisational projects with proven skills and experience in policy and strategy development
  • Exceptional problem-solving and strategic thinking capabilities with experience in developing creative and innovative solutions to complex problems and the ability to conceptualise future opportunities, scenarios and critically assess policy alternatives
  • Outstanding project management skills in leading and participating in cross-corporate and multi-organisational projects including project planning, resource management and ensuring delivery of outcomes within budget and to agreed timeframes
  • Comprehensive understanding of urban planning principles and processes and an understanding of the range of issues impinging upon capital city planning.

To view the physical requirements of this position, please see below under Position Information.

How to apply…

As part of the online application form you are required to:

  • attach your resume
  • attach a separate cover letter
  • respond to the selection criteria, in a separate document (no more than two pages), as listed above under ‘You can bring…’


Please address your covering letter to Robyn Hellman, Team Leader Planning Policy


The position description for this role will not be provided at this stage of application.

The Advertised Close Date and other important information can be found on www.melbourne.vic.gov.au/careers .

City of Melbourne is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a safe working environment that embraces and values child safety , diversity and inclusion.

If you have a disability and require advice and support during the recruitment process, we encourage you to apply or contact us on the details listed below.

For information about the broader collection and use of personal information by the City of Melbourne, please refer to our Privacy Policy .
